topic_metadata.title: Is it possible to #show ∂ₜ as ∂_t in math?

posts.name: Y.D.X.
posts.cooked:
Is it possible to #show ∂ₜ as ∂_t, and a ₜ as a_t in math?

In the following matrix, I want to input as the second column, and display as the first column.

$ mat(diff_t, ∂ₜ; a_t, a ₜ) $
#repr[$ mat(diff_t, ∂ₜ; a_t, a ₜ) $]


equation(
  block: true,
  body: mat(
  rows: (
      (
        attach(base: [∂], b: [t]),
        sequence([∂], [ₜ]),
      ),
      (
        attach(base: [a], b: [t]),
        sequence([a], [ ], [ₜ]),
      ),
    ),
  ),
)

I have tried some possibilities, but I have no idea how to turn ₜ into an argument of the attach function.

Any explanation or help is appreciated. Thanks in advance.
posts.raw:
Is it possible to `#show` `∂ₜ` as `∂_t`, and `a ₜ` as `a_t` in math?

In the following matrix, I want to input as the second column, and display as the first column.

```typst
$ mat(diff_t, ∂ₜ; a_t, a ₜ) $
#repr[$ mat(diff_t, ∂ₜ; a_t, a ₜ) $]
```

![|128x102](upload://fcl2KCON3pqXEgGzCgM7AdJ3KG7.png)

```typc
equation(
  block: true,
  body: mat(
  rows: (
      (
        attach(base: [∂], b: [t]),
        sequence([∂], [ₜ]),
      ),
      (
        attach(base: [a], b: [t]),
        sequence([a], [ ], [ₜ]),
      ),
    ),
  ),
)
```

I have tried some possibilities, but I have no idea how to turn `ₜ` into an argument of the `attach` function.

Any explanation or help is appreciated. Thanks in advance.

posts.name: Eric Biedert
posts.cooked:
The super-suboptimal package seems to do what you want:

#import "@preview/super-suboptimal:0.1.0": super-subscripts
#show: super-subscripts

$ mat(diff_t, ∂ₜ; a_t, a ₜ) $
posts.raw:
The [super-suboptimal](https://typst.app/universe/package/super-suboptimal) package seems to do what you want:

```typ
#import "@preview/super-suboptimal:0.1.0": super-subscripts
#show: super-subscripts

$ mat(diff_t, ∂ₜ; a_t, a ₜ) $
```

![Output of example code|125x90](upload://NhaloY1xX51XWswW4QYW3kvbko.png)
